newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Tuesday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing
prices and are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.

Traders said the rates moved narrowly today with some major state-run banks lending out large amounts of money which were mainly absorbed by securities houses and brokerages who need money to speculate in the active domestic A shares.
They believe the trend would not change in the short term but the rates were likely to fall slowly in the mid-term mainly due to an expected cut in bank reserve ratios.
The People's Bank of China, the central bank, has said it would cut the ratios within this year and traders expect the cut to release large amounts of cash to the interbank market.
